Release Notes: - update to Instrument Framework v1.10.3
item.dc:creator: Levylab

item.title: Instrument Framework v1.10.3.7
item.description:
Product: Instrument Framework v1.10.3.7
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Wed, 20 Oct 2021 08:25:47 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: An object-oriented framework based on JKI SMOs, developed by the LevyLab at the University of Pittsburgh.

An Instrument developed using this framework will have the access to the following capabilities:

- Method for communicate with a piece of hardware (provides a hardware abstraction layer (HAL))
- Periodically polls the instrument for its settings and logs them to a PGSQL database
- Defines an API to allow external programs to control compiled instances of the application and remotely across a network (Either NI's Simple Messaging Library (STM) (deprecated in v1.9) or cross-platform protocol ZMQ (preferred beginning with v1.9))
- Provide a user interface (optional but probably desirable).
- Methods for reading and writing configuration from disk.

The Instrument Framework makes extensive use of JKI State Machines and State Machine Objects.

Release Notes: [1.10.3]
- Update RemoteControl:Close to clear messages from class wire
item.dc:creator: LevyLab

item.title: LV-Data v3.2.0.3
item.description:
Product: LV-Data v3.2.0.3
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Wed, 20 Oct 2021 08:24:30 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: Collection of VIs to write and read Igor Text Files (*.itx), text-based spreadsheet data files (*.dat), and TDMS

Release Notes: [3.2.0]

LV-Data.lvclass:
- Fix issue that would result in the wrong file extension being written

LV-Data.PGSQL:
- Write Variable.vi
- now polymorphic with options for writing one or multiple rows
- back-dated data can be written in either
- Updated Administer Tables UI.vi
- rearranged UI
- new features such as Delete Tables, Move Column between tables
item.dc:creator: LevyLab

Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Tue, 19 Oct 2021 15:16:16 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: An object-oriented framework based on JKI SMOs, developed by the LevyLab at the University of Pittsburgh.

An Instrument developed using this framework will have the access to the following capabilities:

- Method for communicate with a piece of hardware (provides a hardware abstraction layer (HAL))
- Periodically polls the instrument for its settings and logs them to a PGSQL database
- Defines an API to allow external programs to control compiled instances of the application and remotely across a network (Either NI's Simple Messaging Library (STM) (deprecated in v1.9) or cross-platform protocol ZMQ (preferred beginning with v1.9))
- Provide a user interface (optional but probably desirable).
- Methods for reading and writing configuration from disk.

The Instrument Framework makes extensive use of JKI State Machines and State Machine Objects.

Release Notes: [1.10.2]
- Add Write Hardware Address.vi
- Add ACK.vi API
- Updated Palette

item.dc:creator: LevyLab

item.title: Multichannel Lockin v2.14.6.71
item.description:
Product: Multichannel Lockin v2.14.6.71
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Tue, 19 Oct 2021 09:16:17 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: Multichannel Lockin for National Instruments' Dynamic Signal Acquisition hardware (4431, 4461, 4462). This version is configured to handle multiple cards (up to 16) for simultaneous, synchronized AI/AO. You can configure a number of analog outputs (up to 32) to output sine, square, sawtooth, or triangle functions with DC offsets. Each of the analog inputs (up to 32) can be demodulated at multiple frequencies.

Release Notes: [2.14.6]
- Fix Issue #47: Handle Command not replying to the proper data cluster
item.dc:creator: LevyLab
